quotes.body: Under no pretext should arms and ammunition be surrendered; any attempt to disarm the workers must be frustrated, by force if necessary.
quotes.speaker: Karl Marx

quotes.body: As revolutionaries, we don't have the right to say we are tired of explaining. We must never stop explaining. We know that when the people understand, they cannot help but follow us.
quotes.speaker: Thomas Sankara

quotes.body: In every male languishes the soul of a feudal lord, a male chauvinist, which must be destroyed.
quotes.speaker: Thomas Sankara

quotes.body: The oppressed are allowed once every few years to decide which particular representatives of the oppressing class are to represent and repress them.
quotes.speaker: Karl Marx

quotes.body: Let the ruling classes tremble at a Communistic revolution. The proletarians have nothing to lose but their chains. They have a world to win.
quotes.speaker: Karl Marx

quotes.body: Is it not violent for a child to go to bed hungry in the richest country in the world? I think that is violent. But that type of violence is so institutionalized that it becomes a part of our way of life...
quotes.speaker: Kwame Ture

quotes.body: When you see people call themselves revolutionary always talking about destroying, destroying, destroying but never talking about building or creating, they’re not revolutionary. They do not understand the first thing about revolution. It’s creating.
quotes.speaker: Kwame Ture

quotes.body: You can never make an analysis of the oppressed in any aspect of their lives and leave out the oppressor. If you do so, you'll blame the oppressed for their condition.
quotes.speaker: Kwame Ture
